A version of this story was published in a blog post.  

I wrote it for Harvard Business Review.  

The post is called “If You Don’t Prioritize Your Life, Someone Else Will.”  

It was published on June 28, 2012.  

The link is http://blogs.hbr.org/2012/06/how-to-say-no-to-a-controlling/.  

Originally, I called it “the Clarity Paradox.”  

This was in another blog post for Harvard Business Review.  

That post is called “The Disciplined Pursuit of Less.”  

It was published on August 8, 2012.  

The link is http://blogs.hbr.org/2012/08/the-disciplined-pursuit-of-less/.  

I have drawn from other HBR blogs I have written.  

These are in various parts of this book.  

Jim Collins wrote "How the Mighty Fall: And Why Some Companies Never Give In."  

It was published by HarperCollins in New York, 2009.  

Peter Drucker wrote “Managing Knowledge Means Managing Oneself.”  

It was published in Leader to Leader Journal, no. 16, Spring 2000.  

The link is www.hesselbeininstitute.org/knowledgecenter/journal.aspx?ArticleID=26.  

Shai Danziger, Jonathan Levav, and Liora Avnaim-Pessoa wrote “Extraneous Factors in Judicial Decisions.”  

It was published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, 108, no. 17, 2011.  

The pages are 6889–92.  

Bronnie Ware wrote “The Top Five Regrets of the Dying.”
